Name: Create & Disseminate Knowledge
Documentation: The university's entire capability to generate new knowledge through research, package it into educational offerings, and deliver it to students and society.

Name: Develop & Manage Academic Portfolio
Documentation: The capability to design, approve, and manage the portfolio of academic programs and courses offered by the university.

Name: Manage Student Lifecycle
Documentation: The capability to manage the entire student journey, from initial recruitment and admission through to graduation and alumni status.

Name: Execute Research & Innovation Lifecycle
Documentation: The capability to secure funding for, execute, and disseminate research, as well as to manage the process of protecting and commercializing resulting innovations.

Name: Foster External Engagement & Impact
Documentation: The capability to build and maintain relationships with external stakeholders, including alumni, industry partners, and potential licensees, to maximize societal and economic impact.

Name: Govern University Enterprise
Documentation: The capability to provide the strategic direction, foundational resources, and administrative oversight required for all academic and research activities.

Name: Curriculum Design & Management
Documentation: The ability to create and maintain curricula, including learning outcomes, course content, and assessment strategies.

Name: Academic Program Portfolio Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the overall portfolio of academic programs, ensuring strategic alignment, viability, and market relevance.

Name: Student Recruitment & Admissions Management
Documentation: The ability to attract, evaluate, and admit qualified students into the university's programs.

Name: Student Administration & Records Management
Documentation: The ability to manage student records, enrollment, academic progress, and the conferral of degrees.

Name: Teaching & Learning Delivery
Documentation: The ability to deliver high-quality instruction and learning experiences to students.

Name: Student Welfare & Support Management
Documentation: The ability to provide non-academic support services to students, including counseling, financial aid, and disability services.

Name: Grant & Proposal Development
Documentation: The ability to identify funding opportunities and develop compelling research proposals to secure grants.

Name: Research Execution Management
Documentation: The ability to conduct research, including data collection, analysis, and interpretation, in a rigorous and ethical manner.

Name: Research Dissemination Management
Documentation: The ability to publish and otherwise share research findings with the academic community and the public.

Name: Invention Assessment & Triage
Documentation: The ability to evaluate invention disclosures from researchers to determine their commercial potential.

Name: Intellectual Property Management
Documentation: The ability to protect university innovations through patents, copyrights, and other legal means.

Name: Alumni Relations Management
Documentation: The ability to maintain long-term relationships with graduates for networking, fundraising, and community-building purposes.

Name: Technology Marketing & Licensing Management
Documentation: The ability to market university technologies to industry and negotiate licensing agreements.

Name: Partner Relationship Management
Documentation: The ability to establish and manage strategic partnerships with industry, government, and other organizations.

Name: Strategic Research Planning
Documentation: The ability to set strategic priorities for research and allocate resources accordingly.

Name: Faculty & Staff Management
Documentation: The ability to recruit, develop, and manage academic and professional staff.

Name: Research Infrastructure Management
Documentation: The ability to manage and maintain laboratories, equipment, and other facilities essential for research.

Name: Research Methodology Development
Documentation: The ability to develop and refine the scientific methods and protocols used in research.

Name: Financial Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the university's financial resources, including tuition, grants, endowments, and operational budgets.

Name: Legal & Contract Management
Documentation: The ability to manage legal risks and negotiate contracts with students, funders, and partners.

Name: Research Ethics & Compliance Management
Documentation: The ability to ensure all research activities adhere to ethical standards and regulatory requirements.

Name: University Asset
Documentation: The complete set of tangible and intangible assets that the university creates, manages, and leverages, including its knowledge, relationships, and resources.

Name: Academic Portfolio
Documentation: The collection of all approved academic programs and their constituent parts, representing the university's educational offerings.

Name: Student Relationship
Documentation: The representation of the end-to-end engagement with a student, from applicant to alumnus.

Name: Research & Innovation Asset
Documentation: The collection of intellectual assets generated through the research lifecycle, from initial ideas to protected IP.

Name: External Engagement
Documentation: The set of formal relationships and agreements with external parties, such as alumni and commercial partners.

Name: Governing Principle & Resource
Documentation: The collection of strategic mandates, policies, and core resources that enable the university's operations.

Name: Academic Program Proposal
Documentation: A formal document outlining the rationale, structure, and curriculum for a new or revised academic program.

Name: Approved Program
Documentation: A fully vetted and approved academic program, authorized for delivery to students.

Name: Course Content
Documentation: The materials, lectures, and activities that constitute a specific academic course.

Name: Assessment Framework
Documentation: The defined methods and criteria for evaluating student learning and performance.

Name: Program Catalogue Entry
Documentation: The official public listing of an academic program, including its description, requirements, and admission criteria.

Name: Student Application
Documentation: A formal request from a prospective student for admission to a specific program.

Name: Student Enrollment
Documentation: The official record of a student's registration in a program and its courses for a specific academic term.

Name: Learning Experience
Documentation: The delivery of instructional content and activities to a student.

Name: Academic Transcript
Documentation: The official record of a student's academic performance, including courses taken and grades received.

Name: Student Support Case
Documentation: A record of a specific request for non-academic support or assistance by a student.

Name: Academic Credential
Documentation: The official degree, diploma, or certificate awarded to a student upon successful completion of a program.

Name: Grant Opportunity
Documentation: An identified call for proposals or funding opportunity from a government agency, foundation, or corporation.

Name: Research Proposal
Documentation: A formal document submitted to a funding body, detailing the objectives, methodology, and budget for a proposed research project.

Name: Raw Research Data
Documentation: The unprocessed data collected during the course of a research project.

Name: Verified Research Finding
Documentation: An interpretation of research data that has been validated and is ready for dissemination.

Name: Published Research
Documentation: A research finding that has been formally published in a peer-reviewed journal, conference proceeding, or book.

Name: Invention Disclosure
Documentation: A formal document submitted by a researcher to the university, describing a new invention or discovery.

Name: Commercial Viability Assessment
Documentation: An analysis of the market potential and technical feasibility of a disclosed invention.

Name: Patent or Copyright
Documentation: A legal instrument that protects the university's intellectual property rights to an invention or creative work.

Name: Alumni Record
Documentation: The official record of a graduate, used for communication and engagement.

Name: Licensing Prospect
Documentation: A potential industry partner identified as a candidate for licensing a university technology.

Name: Commercialization Agreement
Documentation: A legally binding contract that grants a third party the rights to use and commercialize university-owned intellectual property.

Name: Strategic Research Mandate
Documentation: A formal directive outlining a priority area for research investment and development.

Name: Faculty Appointment
Documentation: The formal contract and terms of employment for a member of the academic staff.

Name: Research Infrastructure
Documentation: The physical labs, equipment, and core facilities established to support research activities.

Name: Research Protocol
Documentation: A detailed, step-by-step plan for conducting a specific experiment or research procedure.

Name: Tuition Payment
Documentation: A financial transaction representing the payment of fees by a student for educational services.

Name: Grant Financial Statement
Documentation: A report detailing the income and expenditure associated with a specific research grant.

Name: Royalty Payment
Documentation: A financial transaction representing income received from the licensing of intellectual property.

Name: Core Research Grant
Documentation: Foundational funding secured to establish a research capability, often from internal sources or large institutional grants.

Name: Research Grant
Documentation: A contract with an external body to fund a specific research project.

Name: Grant Report
Documentation: A formal report submitted to a funding body, detailing the progress and outcomes of a funded research project.

Name: Develop Educational Offerings
Documentation: A value stream for the design, approval, and cataloging of academic programs and courses before any students are enrolled.

Name: Build Research Capabilities
Documentation: A value stream for establishing the foundational faculty, facilities, and expertise in strategic research areas, independent of any specific grant or project.

Name: Educate to Graduate
Documentation: A value stream triggered by a student's application to an existing program, covering the entire lifecycle from admission to graduation.

Name: Research to Impact
Documentation: A value stream triggered by a specific funding opportunity or research question, covering the entire project lifecycle from proposal to dissemination of findings.

Name: Innovate to Commercialize
Documentation: A value stream triggered by the disclosure of a new invention, covering the process of protecting and licensing the intellectual property to an external partner.

Name: Define Academic Product
Documentation: The stages within the Develop Educational Offerings stream focused on designing and defining the academic product.

Name: Establish Research Foundations
Documentation: The stages within the Build Research Capabilities stream focused on establishing the core resources and direction for research.

Name: Deliver Student Journey
Documentation: The core stages of the Educate to Graduate stream that directly involve the student's academic and support experience.

Name: Manage Student Engagement
Documentation: The stages within the Educate to Graduate stream focused on post-graduation and external relationship management.

Name: Administer Student Progression
Documentation: The administrative and financial stages that support the student's progression through their program.

Name: Execute Research Project
Documentation: The core stages of the Research to Impact stream focused on the scientific and intellectual work of the project.

Name: Administer Research Project
Documentation: The administrative and financial stages that support the execution of a research project.

Name: Execute Commercialization
Documentation: The core stages of the Innovate to Commercialize stream focused on assessing and protecting the intellectual property.

Name: Manage Partner Engagement
Documentation: The stages within the Innovate to Commercialize stream focused on engaging with external partners.

Name: Administer Commercialization
Documentation: The administrative and financial stages that support the commercialization of an invention.

Name: Design Program
Documentation: The stage of creating the initial proposal for a new academic program.

Name: Approve Curriculum
Documentation: The stage of formally reviewing and approving the program's curriculum and structure.

Name: Develop Course Materials
Documentation: The stage of creating the specific content, lectures, and resources for the program's courses.

Name: Establish Assessment Methods
Documentation: The stage of defining how student learning will be measured and graded.

Name: List Program in Catalogue
Documentation: The stage of making the approved program publicly visible and available for applications.

Name: Identify Strategic Research Area
Documentation: The stage of determining a priority area for institutional investment in research.

Name: Recruit Principal Investigators
Documentation: The stage of hiring key academic staff to lead research in the strategic area.

Name: Establish Labs & Facilities
Documentation: The stage of creating the physical infrastructure required for the research.

Name: Develop Core Methodologies
Documentation: The stage of defining the standard scientific protocols and approaches for the research area.

Name: Secure Foundational Funding
Documentation: The stage of acquiring the initial capital to launch the research capability.

Name: Recruit & Admit Student
Documentation: The stage of attracting applicants and selecting qualified candidates for a program.

Name: Onboard & Register Student
Documentation: The stage of formally enrolling an admitted student and integrating them into the university.

Name: Deliver Instruction
Documentation: The stage of providing teaching and learning activities to students.

Name: Assess Student Performance
Documentation: The stage of evaluating student work and recording their academic progress.

Name: Provide Student Support
Documentation: The stage of offering non-academic assistance to students to support their well-being and success.

Name: Collect Tuition Fees
Documentation: The stage of invoicing students for their tuition and processing payments.

Name: Confer Degree
Documentation: The stage of formally awarding the academic credential to a student who has met all program requirements.

Name: Maintain Alumni Relations
Documentation: The stage of managing the ongoing relationship with graduates.

Name: Identify Funding Opportunity
Documentation: The stage of finding and qualifying potential sources of funding for a research idea.

Name: Develop Research Proposal
Documentation: The stage of writing and submitting a formal application for a research grant.

Name: Secure Grant Agreement
Documentation: The stage of finalizing the legal contract for a successful grant application.

Name: Conduct Research & Experiments
Documentation: The stage of executing the planned research activities and collecting data.

Name: Analyze & Interpret Data
Documentation: The stage of processing raw data to produce meaningful scientific findings.

Name: Manage Grant Finances
Documentation: The stage of tracking and reporting on the expenditure of grant funds.

Name: Disseminate Findings
Documentation: The stage of sharing research results through publications, conferences, and other channels.

Name: Report to Funder
Documentation: The stage of providing formal progress and final reports to the funding body.

Name: Disclose Invention
Documentation: The stage where a researcher formally reports a new discovery or invention to the university.

Name: Assess Commercial Potential
Documentation: The stage of evaluating an invention's marketability and technical feasibility.

Name: Secure Intellectual Property
Documentation: The stage of filing for patents or other forms of legal protection for an invention.

Name: Market Technology to Partners
Documentation: The stage of identifying and contacting potential industry licensees for the technology.

Name: Negotiate Licensing Agreement
Documentation: The stage of finalizing the legal and financial terms for a commercialization deal.

Name: Manage Royalties & Compliance
Documentation: The stage of collecting licensing income and ensuring the licensee adheres to the agreement terms.
